Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database size, performance, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use the database.
Design the database architecture, including the choice of Single Server or Flexible Server deployment, storage options, and high availability configurations.
Choose the appropriate pricing tier based on performance requirements, storage needs, and budget constraints.
Create the Azure Database for MySQL instance in the Azure portal, CLI, or PowerShell. Configure initial settings such as region, compute, and storage.
Set up firewall rules to allow access to the database from specific IP addresses or Azure services.
Configure SSL/TLS encryption for secure connections to the database. Ensure certificates are properly installed and validated.

Tasks.Task: Set Up Backup and Restore Policies
Tasks.Task Description: Configure automated backups and define restore policies to ensure data resiliency and recovery options.
Enable high availability features such as zone-redundant deployments or read replicas to ensure database uptime.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools to track database performance, availability, and security.
Analyze and optimize database performance by configuring query performance insights, indexing, and tuning parameters.
Apply security best practices such as role-based access control (RBAC), data encryption, and auditing to protect the database.
Perform thorough testing of database connectivity, query execution, and application integration to ensure proper functionality.
Document the database setup, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Ensure the database setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Use Azure Monitor and Query Performance Insights to continuously monitor the performance of the MySQL database. Identify slow queries and optimize them.
Regularly check for and apply security updates to the MySQL database to ensure protection against vulnerabilities.
Ensure regular backups of the MySQL database are performed and stored securely. Verify the integrity of backups periodically.
Review and audit database access logs to ensure compliance with security policies and detect unauthorized access.
Periodically review and optimize database configurations, such as connection limits, query cache, and storage settings, to ensure optimal performance.
Conduct regular disaster recovery tests to ensure backups can be restored and failover mechanisms are functional.
Review and update security policies, including firewall rules and access controls, to adapt to changes in the database environment.
Track resource utilization metrics such as CPU, memory, and storage to ensure the database operates within expected parameters.
Regularly review and maintain database indexes to ensure efficient query performance.
Perform regular compliance checks to ensure the database setup adheres to relevant regulations and industry standards.
Evaluate the SLA performance of the Azure Database for MySQL service. Address any issues or deviations from the agreed SLA metrics.
Develop and execute plans for database upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new MySQL features, best practices, and security measures.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding database performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
